author: data.always
content: considering that builders can still pack blocks to censor transactions, it seems reasonable to delay ILs by one block and reduce bandwidth by 99%

author: data.always
content: any reason we wouldn't just use historic mempool data? curious if anyone has actually done empirical analysis on the impact.

author: terencechain
content: we could but what i meant is to implement an inclusion list gossip subnet on mainnet and nodes can opt in to build inclusion list with public mempool and broadcast inclusion list

author: pellekrab
content: This isnt much of a concern though since builders will quickly become unprofitable.

author: potuz
content: The point is that inclusion is guaranteed because of this exponential increase in price. But short time censorship is trivially cheap so it's useless to try to push it to the IL gadget

author: pellekrab
content: Especially if 6 sec slots is shipped a 1 slot delay isnt that bad.

author: soispoke
content: I think that if we go towards shorter and shorter slots the fact that there is a view merge mechanism in FOCIL itself means a decoupling between IL updates and slot time but that's fine

author: data.always
content: small clarification: the increase in price is only exponential until the base fee gets above the gas price of the censored transaction. then builders could just hold the base fee indefinitely at constant price.

author: soispoke
content: true, that would probably also be pretty costly (fill up blocks up to the target at a relatively with a base fee higher than what the censored tx is willing to pay) and you need to keep winning mev boost auctions while doing that (meaning with less txns so less potential MEV extraction)

author: pellekrab
content: Itd be cool to have a builder bounty program for focil on a test net, and see how realistic these attacks actually are.
